thread.title: Ohio zoo presses charges against man who petted cougars
thread.title_full: Ohio zoo presses charges against man who petted cougars | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Ohio zoo presses charges against man who petted cougars
text:
An Ohio zoo has pressed charges against a man who jumped over a fence with a video camera to film himself petting cougars.
The Columbus Zoo and Aquarium says the Delaware County Sheriff's office pressed charges against local man, Joshua Newell, for criminal trespassing.
Sheriff's spokeswoman Tracy Whited says the 35-year-old was served last Friday with a summons to appear in court Wednesday.
The video was posted to YouTube by Newell and captures him jumping the outer fence of the cougar enclosure and approaching the animals.
He then calls over to them and begins petting them through the fence while saying such things as: 'Kitty, kitty, kitty,' and 'that's a good kitty.'

Caught on camera: Terrifying moment KLM plane banked sharply... President and CEO of the Columbus Zoo, Tom Stalf, said in a statement that it is fortunate that neither he nor the animals were harmed.
He said: 'Animal welfare and safety are two of our top priorities.
'Barriers, like the fence line at the cougar habitat, are in place to keep our guests and animals safe.
'The actions taken in this video were alarming and resulted in our decision to press charges.'
